means: 撤回或撤消( retract的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He made a false confession which he later retracted.
sentence.Network_cn: 他作了假供词，后来又翻供。
一个球童收回了他的话.

sentence.Network_en: The eyes are often retracted from dehydration.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Such a discovery was first announced , and then retracted , some years ago ., 这个发现早在几年前就被发布 , 但后来被收回.

the chaos lasted only 18 years after which so many had perished due to radiation poisoning that the few remaining retracted into the far north , began to farm their own food and survived .混乱仅仅持续18年后，有如此多人由于辐射毒素而死亡，仅留下少数人撤离到遥远的北方，开始自己耕种粮食并存活下来。
...-vowel）／w／时，／k，g／变体的舌位比平常靠后（retracted），同时双唇要收圆（rounded）。
retractatio 重写, retracted 收回的, retracted 收上的

list.abs: retraction 退缩retraction ring 收缩环retractor 牵开器缩肌
1 2 3 4 5 ... 可收放的起落架^ retractable landing gear 活动铅笔^ retractable pencil 钢卷尺^ retractable steel rule.
retractable backup arm 可复位推靠臂retractable bit 伸缩式钻头retractable core bit 可收缩取出的取心钻头.
retention time 停留时间retraction stress 收缩应力reversible change 可逆变化

entry.tran: 收回，撤回(所说的话或写的东西)
entry.def: If you retract something that you have said or written, you say that you did not mean it.

example.ex: Mr Smith hurriedly sought to retract the statement, but it had just been broadcast on national radio...
example.tran: 史密斯先生想赶快收回这项声明，但它刚刚已经在国家电台播出了。

example.ex: He's hoping that if he makes me feel guilty, I'll retract.
example.tran: 他指望着如果他能让我感到内疚，我就会收回所说的话。

entry.def: When a part of a machine or a part of a person's body retracts or is retracted, it moves inwards or becomes shorter.

example.ex: Torn muscles retract, and lose strength, structure, and tightness.
example.tran: 撕裂的肌肉会收缩，丧失原来的力量、结构和紧实度。
当飞机的轮子收起来的时候

auth_sentence.content: The lips of the wound were retracted and gaping.

auth_sentence.content: That version of events has since been retracted.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: That version of events has since been retracted.

auth_sentence.content: Five minutes later an embarrassed Japanese government retracted the alert.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Five minutes later an embarrassed Japanese government retracted the alert.
